camel.sink.path.database.name: camel.sink.path.database
camel.sink.path.database.description: Path to database file. Will be created if not exists.

camel.sink.endpoint.collection.name: camel.sink.endpoint.collection
camel.sink.endpoint.collection.description: Name of Nitrite collection. Cannot be used in combination with repositoryClass option.

camel.sink.endpoint.repositoryClass.name: camel.sink.endpoint.repositoryClass
camel.sink.endpoint.repositoryClass.description: Class of Nitrite ObjectRepository. Cannot be used in combination with collection option.

camel.sink.endpoint.repositoryName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.repositoryName
camel.sink.endpoint.repositoryName.description: Optional name of ObjectRepository. Can be only used in combination with repositoryClass, otherwise have no effect

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.sink.endpoint.password.name: camel.sink.endpoint.password
camel.sink.endpoint.password.description: Password for Nitrite database. Required, if option username specified.

camel.sink.endpoint.username.name: camel.sink.endpoint.username
camel.sink.endpoint.username.description: Username for Nitrite database. Database is not secured if option not specified.

camel.component.nitrite.lazyStartProduce.name: camel.component.nitrite.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.nitrite.lazyStartProduce.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.nitrite.basicPropertyBin.name: camel.component.nitrite.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.nitrite.basicPropertyBin.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities
